course.subject: IELM
course.name: Design of Logistics and Manufacturing Systems
course.description: Facility location, process and material flow analysis, space allocation and plant layout, computerized layout planning, material handling equipment, material handling system design.

reviews.author: Clear pool
reviews.title: Good to study, but the project is not easy
reviews.comment_content:
The contents was very good and applicable in real manufacturing field and supply chain. There was a project to help you practice the skills had learnt in the lecture. The project needs to be a real problem and the solution have to actually work. It is better to have a group mate which can access to real data about warehouse, factory, logistics facilities etc.
In the tutorial, it would teach some useful software about the skills learnt, such as Excel VBA and BLOCPLAN.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since Emily Au is a Hong Kongese, normal Hong Kong students can understand her English. She explained things well with suitable examples and liked asking questions in the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: 3 quizzes each for 20%, 10% labs and HWs, 5% Class participation which is PRS questions and a project for 25%. Normally the mean of quizzes was about 70% of total marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Homework is not too much, only 3 homeworks (although there were quite long, but they were similar to the HW  before), but there is a project which counts for 25% of final grade, it gave me quite a lot of pressure.

reviews.author: alvincheung
reviews.title: Not a bad choice
reviews.comment_content:
This course is designed to provide some fundamental concepts, theories and procedures for the study of facility location, process and material flow analysis, physical layouts, computerized layout planning, warehouse operations, and material handling.

quite easy to be followed.
Cheatsheets are allowed in midterm and final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor is quite responsive to the students' inquiries.
However, sometimes you might find TA hard to be reached and they are not quite responsive to your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grades compared to other IE courses.
Assessment and Grades
Homework + Lab reports 15%
Project 20%
Mid-term exam 30%
Final Exam 35%
reviews.comment_workload:
Light comparing to other IE courses

1* Midterm
4* Homework
6* Lab (Very easy to be finished)
1* Project
1* Final
